title: Chain-Talker: Chain Understanding and Rendering for Empathetic Conversational Speech Synthesis
author: Yifan Hu (Inner Mongolia University), Rui Liu (Inner Mongolia University), Yi Ren (ByteDance), Xiang Yin (ByteDance), Haizhou Li (Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen), ...
relevance_why: The paper introduces innovative methods for empathetic speech synthesis, which can be useful for Haohe Liu's research in text-to-audio generation and audio language modeling, especially in enhancing the emotional expressiveness of generated audio content.
background: The research proposes a model for generating empathetic speech in user-agent dialogues, focusing on understanding emotions and rendering suitable responses.
contribution: Chain-Talker introduces a three-stage framework—Emotion Understanding, Semantic Understanding, and Empathetic Rendering—to enhance empathetic conversational speech synthesis, achieving improved expressiveness and emotional alignment.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models often struggle with emotional perception and result in redundant speech representations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work decouples emotion and semantics into distinct yet collaborative processes, improving interpretability and reducing redundancy in generated speech.

key_innovation: It uniquely integrates emotional understanding into the synthesis process, allowing for context-aware emotion rendering in conversational speech.
real_world_impact: This model may significantly benefit applications like virtual assistants and social robots by enabling more natural and emotionally intelligent interactions with users.
limitations: The paper indicates potential issues with inference latency and robustness, highlighting the need for more diverse datasets to improve generalization across various speaker demographics.

new_terms.Conversational Speech Synthesis (CSS): **Conversational Speech Synthesis (CSS)** refers to generating human-like speech that aligns with emotional and contextual cues during interactions between users and AI agents.
new_terms.Optimal Transport (OT): **Optimal Transport (OT)** is a mathematical theory that deals with the problem of transforming one probability distribution into another most efficiently.

open_sourcing: Code and demos are available at: https://github.com/AI-S2-Lab/Chain-Talker
